intro: Alleizettella leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited alleizettella, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by distinctive white, fleshy fruits that are adapted for animal dispersal. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in its native habitat.
